enWisdom: At times one from whom sincere advice is sought, deceives
Sometimes advice is given by one who is not sincere
The one from whom [good] advice is sought may at times deceive
He who deems the sincere adviser to be a deceiver, considers evil to be good
One who considers the sincere adviser to be a deceiver is engulfed by evil

Wisdom: مَرَارَةُ النُّصْحِ أَنْفَعُ مِنْ حَلَاوَةِ الْغِشِّ
enWisdom: The bitterness of sincere advice is more beneficial than the sweetness of deceit

Wisdom: لَا تَنْتَصِحْ بِمَنْ فَاتَهُ الْعَقْلُ وَلَا تَثِقْ بِمَنْ خَانَهُ الْأَصْلُ فَإِنَّ مَنْ فَاتَهُ الْعَقْلُ يَغُشُّ مِنْ حَيْثُ يَنْصَحُ وَمَنْ خَانَهُ الْأَصْلُ يُفْسِدُ مِنْ حَيْثُ يَصْلُحُ
enWisdom: Do not take advice from one who has lost his senses and do not trust one who has an ignoble background, for indeed the one who has lost his senses deceives while he thinks he is offering good advice, and one who has an ignoble background corrupts while he thinks he is rectifying
